short_description: This Function calculates SUM(Xi), SUM(Yi), SUM(Xi^2),SUM(Yi^2), SUM(Xi* Yi) for all the Xi and Yi pairs.
long_description: This function is used as part of the correlation function and is not intended to be used by itself. This Function calculates SUM(Xi), SUM(Yi), SUM(Xi^2), SUM(Yi^2), SUM(Xi* Yi) for all the Xi and Yi pairs.

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: The input table that contains the Xi and Yi pairs.
input_tables.description: The input table that contains the Xi and Yi pairs.

argument_clauses.name: GroupByColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input columns that define the group for correlation calculation. By default, all input columns belong to a single group, for which the function calculates correlation.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the input columns that define the group for correlation calculation. By default, all input columns belong to a single group, for which the function calculates correlation.

argument_clauses.name: KeyName
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name for the Corr_Map output table column that contains the correlations, and by which the Corr_Map output table is partitioned.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name for the Corr_Map output table column that contains the correlations, and by which the Corr_Map output table is partitioned.

argument_clauses.name: TargetColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies pairs of columns for which to calculate correlations. For each column pair, 'col_name1:col_name2', the function calculates the correlation between col_name1 and col_name2. For each column range, '[col_index1:col_index2]', the function calculates the correlation between every pair of columns in the range. For example, if you specify '[1:3]', the function calculates the correlation between the pairs (1,2), (1,3), (2,3),(1,1),(3,3). The mininum value of col_index1 is 0, and col_index1 must be less than col_index2.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies pairs of columns for which to calculate correlations. For each column pair, 'col_name1:col_name2', the function calculates the correlation between col_name1 and col_name2. For each column range, '[col_index1:col_index2]', the function calculates the correlation between every pair of columns in the range. For example, if you specify '[1:3]', the function calculates the correlation between the pairs (1,2), (1,3), (2,3),(1,1),(3,3). The mininum value of col_index1 is 0, and col_index1 must be less than col_index2.
